description: A quick win: understand Stonewalling: The Silent Weapon.

hook.text: You're crying, begging to talk. They stare at their phone as if you don't exist. Silence becomes the loudest weapon.

buildup.text: Stonewalling is the complete withdrawal from interaction â€” refusing to engage, respond, or acknowledge the other person.

discovery.text: Gottman's research identified stonewalling as one of the 'Four Horsemen' that predict relationship failure.

twist.text: Stonewalling feels like nothing is happening. But the brain reads it as social rejection â€” identical to physical pain.

climax.text: Silence in conflict isn't peace. When used as punishment, it's one of the most damaging things one person can do.

punchline.text: Silence isn't neutral in relationships. Used as punishment, it destroys.

quiz.question: What is stonewalling?
options: Complete withdrawal from interaction as punishment
